abstracts.cdata!:
The project had significant development
            outcomes, however, the overall assessment was
            unsatisfactory. The Bank's performance was responsive,
            flexible, and, pragmatic, supporting a critical phase of the
            transition reform program. However, had the implementation
            schedule been more realistic, the program might have
            achieved better results. Furthermore, the project design was
            flawed by including too many areas of reform for a single
            operation. On the other hand, the borrower made sustained
            and committed efforts to implement the program, but
            inadequacies in staffing and organization, and, weak
            ineffective laws and regulations, hindered success.
            Nevertheless, the program was instrumental in supporting the
            creation of a capital market, in close collaboration with
            other donors, and legal regulations were promulgated to
            strengthen the National Bank of Romania (NBR). The key
            lessons show, that although the Financial and Enterprise
            Sector Adjustment Loan (FESAL) properly focused on financial
            and economic fundamentals, particularly trade
            liberalization, privatization development, and fiscal
            balance restoration, the design of the project was overly
            ambitious, suggesting future operations to focus on limited
            reform areas. A high level counterpart group should design
            and monitor implementation, build up country ownership, and
            ensure a realistic implementation.
